Sentencas: This paper aims at performing a parametric analysis of the thermoeconomics costs associated with an integrated solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration (VAR) system.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: Particular emphasis is put on the cost of the SOFC's product (i.e. the electrical energy) and on the cost of the VAR's product (i.e. the cooling effect).
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: In order to do so, an hybrid system simulator was constructed to determine the influence of SOFC operating parameters: current density, inlet flow temperature, fuel utilization factor and steam to carbon ratio, on the exergy-based costs of the products as well as on the exergoeconomic factors.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: Results of the analysis show that an energy-based costing can lead to overvaluing the cost of an energy asset.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: Furthermore, the minimum exergy-based unit cost of electricity is 14 $/GJ and of cooling is 16 $/GJ.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: The exergoeconomic factor of the VAR systems is the most affected by the operating variables.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)

Sentencas: From this study, it is concluded that production of cold is not highly cost-effective under the operating conditions studied herein.
Titulo: Parametric analysis of the exergoeconomic variables of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) coupled with a vapour-adsorption refrigeration system (VARS)
